title: How to Make Austrian Onion and Potato Tart

steps.headline: Clean and peel the potatoes.
steps.description: Put them in boiling water with salt. Do not let cook for too long, as they should only be parboiled, not mushy. Remove them from the water and let them cool down slightly, enough to handle with ease.

steps.headline: Cut the onion in half.
steps.description: Make slices of 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thickness; the slices should not be too thin. Put the onion slices into a pan with some butter. Cook them until the onions form a glaze. The onions should not be overcooked, so do not leave them until they becomes brown; just cook enough until they're soft and transparent.

steps.headline: When the onion has softened, add a little milk.
steps.description: Keep cooking but do not let it boil.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from the heat.
steps.description: Beat 2 eggs in a small bowl. Add them to the pan with the onions and stir to combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Add the flour.
steps.description: Mix well, so as to not form lumps.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to a medium oven temperature.
Cut the ​​potatoes into even slices.
steps.description: Layer the potato slices in the baking dish. Add salt to taste, thyme and a teaspoon of olive oil.

steps.headline: Add the onion mixture.
steps.description: Spread this over the potato layers.

steps.headline: Place the dish in the oven.
steps.description: Cook at a medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Check from time to time to see if the top layer has thickened.

steps.headline: Add shredded cheese.
steps.description: When the tart appears ready, sprinkle shredded cheese over the top. Return the dish to the oven for another 5 minutes of cooking, to melt the cheese.

steps.headline: Serve the delicious tart in slices.
steps.description: Add a side salad or steamed vegetables to go with each slice of tart.

text: Clean and peel the potatoes. Put them in boiling water with salt. Do not let cook for too long, as they should only be parboiled, not mushy. Remove them from the water and let them cool down slightly, enough to handle with ease. Cut the onion in half. Make slices of 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thickness; the slices should not be too thin. Put the onion slices into a pan with some butter. Cook them until the onions form a glaze. The onions should not be overcooked, so do not leave them until they becomes brown; just cook enough until they're soft and transparent. When the onion has softened, add a little milk. Keep cooking but do not let it boil. Remove the pan from the heat. Beat 2 eggs in a small bowl. Add them to the pan with the onions and stir to combine the ingredients. Add the flour. Mix well, so as to not form lumps. Preheat the oven to a medium oven temperature.  Cut the ​​potatoes into even slices. Layer the potato slices in the baking dish. Add salt to taste, thyme and a teaspoon of olive oil. Add the onion mixture. Spread this over the potato layers. Place the dish in the oven. Cook at a medium heat for 15-20 minutes. Check from time to time to see if the top layer has thickened. Add shredded cheese. When the tart appears ready, sprinkle shredded cheese over the top. Return the dish to the oven for another 5 minutes of cooking, to melt the cheese. Serve the delicious tart in slices. Add a side salad or steamed vegetables to go with each slice of tart.
